SENT.plain: This case report is of a female fetus diagnosed with severe idiopathic megacystis at 21 weeks of pregnancy
Sonographic monitoring demonstrated normal amniotic fluid volume and renal structures, absence of hydronephrosis, ureteral dilation, and associated abnormalities
Conservative management was chosen with postnatal confirmation of diagnosis
The neonate presented seizures, and subsequent magnetic resonance imaging demonstrated transverse sinus thrombosis with adjacent ischemic damage
At present, the infant is 2 years old, and she is thriving normally and maintains urinary continence with spontaneous voidings. Â© 2011 Wiley Periodicals, Inc
